bill_title: prohibit the use of a cell phone while operating a motor vehicle.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to prohibit the use of a cell phone while operating a motor vehicle. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 32-26 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: For the purposes of this Act, the term, cellular radio telephone, means a wireless telephone authorized by the Federal Communications Commission to operate in the frequency bandwidth reserved for cellular radio telephones. Section 2. That chapter 32-26 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: No person may operate a motor vehicle on the streets or highways of this state while using a cellular radio telephone. However, this prohibition does not apply to the following persons: (1) A law enforcement officer on duty; (2) An emergency vehicle driver on duty; (3) A taxi cab driver on duty; (4) Any person for medical emergency reasons; (5) Any person in physical danger or who reasonably believes another person to be in physical danger; or (6) Any operator of a motor vehicle who has safely removed the vehicle out of the stream of traffic to the shoulder of a street or highway or off the street or highway, and has brought the vehicle to a complete stop. A violation of this section is a Class 2 misdemeanor.
